title: Gary Farrell 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Clone 667 Three Barrel Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is another of the producer's intellectual exercises in experimental winemaking, made in tiny case-production numbers. It offers so much to think about, from its lemony-crisp and tangy palate to its chalky tannins. Full bodied, it merits attention, veering from herbal to chocolaty in one sip.
designation: Gap's Crown Vineyard Clone 667 Three Barrel Selection

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Collection Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Apricot, damask rose and earth frame this vivacious Gewurztraminer that benefits from 2014's verve. The palate comes with some of the characteristic viscosity but the zest of orange and lemon peel balances this out beautifully, creating a lovely, refreshing arc.

title: Iron Horse 2011 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Made from 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, then aged three years, this wine offers a copper-pink color followed by dry, firm acidity and highlights of cherry, cassis and grapefruit zest. A gentle nudge of nutmeg closes in on the finish, giving the wine a salty air and complex ending.

title: Kaleidos 2012 Osiris Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of red cherry, cola, root beer, concentrated hibiscus, iced coffee and crushed herbs decorate the nose of this blend of 54% Grenache, 39% Syrah and &% Mourvèdre. The rounded, complex palate shows leathery, dried plums, roasted beef tips, soy sauce and herbes de provence.

title: Trimbach 2013 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Powdery, creamy notes of rose, orange and mandarin oil unite in a concentrated, punchy palate that focuses on taste rather than aroma. This is rounded and rich with an immensely concentrated phenolic vein that lends structure and poise. The finish is lasting but demure.

title: Trimbach 2013 Riesling (Alsace)
description: While this has a tight corset of freshness and structure, expressive notes of peach show their exuberance. The palate again reveals tautness, shot through with lemon purity while the peach delightfully plays around them.

title: Château Sainte-Marguerite 2014 Symphony Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)
description: Packed in an elegant bottle, this is a 100% Vermentino (aka Rolle) wine. The wine has a naturally rich character that is generous while also having plenty of acidity. Lemon and ripe apricots combine easily and giving a smooth, creamy aftertaste.

title: Columbia Crest 2012 Walter Clore Private Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Merlot (80%) is in the lead on this blend, with the rest rounded out by Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Cocoa, dark raspberry, vanilla and toast aromas lead to supple fruit and barrel flavors backed by grainy tannins that need some time in the cellar to smooth out.

title: Cuvaison 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Crisp, yet fuller bodied, with a creamy voluptuousness to the mouthfeel, this wine offers a taste of lemon pith and peach, accented by a floral bouquet of orange blossom. Measured acidity keeps it ebullient in the glass, ending in a hit of Tahitian vanilla.

title: Carol Shelton 2013 Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
description: Hailing from vines planted in 1918 when the Los Angeles area was the state's top vineyard zone, this bottling shows elegant blackberry meringue, lavender chiffon and hedonistic fudge on the nose. Purple flowers also show on the palate, as do Earl Grey tea, plum rinds and black-pepper notes.
designation: Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Califa Estate Grown Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Quite buttery and rich, this bottling shows lemon custard, ripe yellow melon, white peach and buttermilk on the lavish nose. The palate is lush and attention-grabbing, with poached and grilled peach flavors lifted by citrus energy and a vanilla-laced finish.

title: Dobogó 2012 Szent Tamás Betsek Vineyards  (Tokaji)
description: Medium gold in the glass, this wine has a nose of Valencia orange, pear and kumquat. Flavors of lychee, kumquat and apricot mingle on the palate, remaining strong into the mineral-rich finish.

title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2012 Grafenreben Riesling (Alsace)
description: Spicy edges and hints of heady white lily on the nose are bedded in soft, lemony freshness on the palate where a savory, salty note appears. There is concentration and purity, lip-smacking freshness but also glimpses of riper stone fruit. Lots is happening here; this is alive and probably still too young. Drink 2016–2020.

title: Channing Daughters 2013 Mosaico White (Long Island)
description: This field blend of aromatic white varieties intoxicates with its exotic haze of cinnamon, orange peel and turmeric spices. It's lusciously phenolic in mouthfeel, with a deep, penetrating core of dried peach and pear flavors that lingers on and on and on.

title: Buglioni 2010  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: Ripe black plum, leather, chocolate and allspice emerge on this big, brooding wine. The densely concentrated palate offers raisin, blackberry extract, licorice, ground pepper and tobacco alongside ripe, velvety tannins and the warmth of alcohol. It closes on a licorice note. Drink through 2022.

title: Caliterra 2011 Cenit Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Ripe blackberry, cassis, graphite and pencil wood aromas come with a floral note. This feels full and potent, with oaky, lightly salty flavors of earthy berry and plum. On the finish, a woody reprise entails vanilla and chocolate flavors. Drink this full-bodied Cabernet-led blend through 2020.

title: Balletto 2013 BCD Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate vineyard off Olivet Lane in the heart of the Santa Rosa Plain, this wine is comparatively intense and meaty compared to some of its counterparts from the cooler Sebastopol Hills. Earthy mushroom and a tart, tangy note of orange give it a lift, along with a light layering of fresh-cut rose, before finishing in richer, dark chocolate.

title: Black Stallion 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Earthy in black tea and leathery funk, the feral aspects of this wine are entirely compelling, giving a savory edge around grippy, full-bodied texture and weight. A Pinot for Cabernet fans, it'll stand up to steak and a whole lot more, delivering tremendous value for the quality.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Charlotte's Home Estate Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)
description: Pineapple appears first on the nose and palate, followed by high-toned acidity and a back-up of lemon and lime. Medium bodied, the wine remains light and crisp throughout, finishing in a swirl of lemon zest and grapefruit pith.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Zestiness amid the rounded apricot and rose-petal flavors marks this out, while a pleasant, ever-so-slightly bitter phenolic edge gives just a little bite. The aromatics are subtly expressed and the real action happens on the textured palate.

title: Pech Merle 2012 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)
description: Black pepper and baking spices surround a full-bodied and structured core of raspberry and black cherry in this small-production wine. It finishes in balance and with a touch of elegance.

title: Patricius 2013 Dry Száraz Furmint (Tokaj)
description: Enticing aromas of pear and white peach set the stage for flavors of peach nectar and slightly tart white plum. This wine is full in the mouth with a bright citrus note on the finish.

title: Raymond 2012 Generations Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 97% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Petit Verdot, this wine speaks to power, offering juicy, velvety texture around brawny components of leather, coffee and black plum. Concentrated and intense, it needs time to open in the glass before pairing with thick cuts of meat.

title: San Cassiano 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: Aromas of crushed blue flower, perfumed berry, exotic spice and a whiff of charcuterie emerge on this bold red. The concentrated palate offers dried black cherry, blackberry extract, licorice and ground pepper accompanied by firm, fine-grained tannins.

title: Santa Alicia 2013 Millantu Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of spice and asphalt lend crispness to core blackberry scents. This blend of the three C's—Carmenère, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc—is jammy in feel, with soft, easy tannins. Raspberry, plum, cinnamon and cocoa flavors finish mild except for a touch of heat. Drink now through 2018.

title: Santa Carolina 2013 Reserva de Familia Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Herbal berry, cassis and mint aromas open this classic Maipo Cabernet. Racy acidity and firm tannins make for a structured mouthfeel, while plum, currant, spice and light herbal notes finish loamy. Drink now.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2013 Cote de Madonne Blanc White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This blend of Roussanne, Viognier, Marsanne and Grenache Blanc has a serious line of minerality apparent on the nose as well as pear blossom, pineapple-guava skin and a dairy tang. The palate clings to Meyer lemon pith and Greek yogurt flavors.

title: Frank Family 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Accented by 11% Merlot and smaller percentages of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, this smooth, oaky wine offers dark black fruit and vanilla, with a swirl of bittersweet chocolate on the finish. Ready to enjoy now, it's robustly made and in balance.

title: Galerie 2014 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)
description: An inviting hint of coconut water opens the bouquet of this wine, followed by lemon zest, lime and grapefruit. Oak makes an appearance on the palate, but with subtlety, finishing dry and refreshing with a lightness to the end.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2013 Cap Insula Red (Languedoc)
description: Pressed carnation and violet lead the bouquet of this red blend, surrounded by notes of raw fennel, licorice root, cassis, boysenberry and black plum. It's a rich and ripe selection, but well balanced, with medium, gripping tannins that frame the lush black-fruit flavors. Hints of black tea and baking spice linger on the finish.
